name: ROV
description:
ROV is a short game inspired by deep-sea ROV footage, especially the grainy low-quality footage from the 1990's.

Control an overcomplicated ROV (Remotely Operated Vehicle) and multi-jointed arm as you collect some samples of organic material that have begun to form on the side of an oil-rig riser.

NOTES: 

  • The game uses the Unity HD render pipeline and large texture sizes so it will likely not run well on lower-end hardware.
  • It was my first time working with these types of physics systems so apologies if it's occasionally wonky.

TIPS:

  • You can refer to the controls by pressing the Esc key
  • Switching between cameras (1 and 2) can help you with the manipulator (arm)
  • Zooming in and out (Q and E) can help, plus it looks more like the source inspiration!
  • If you're stuck check your depth gauge (DPT) and compare it to the samples' location

Content Warnings: Thalassophobia, Submechanophobia
